business.headline: Apple nears $4 trillion valuation amid AI push and iPhone upgrade hopesApple's strategic push into AI and its resilience in navigating market challenges have positioned the tech giant as a leader in the sector.
Greaves Cotton share price gains over 10% today. What's behind the rally? Greaves Cotton stock price: The company's shares were trading 10.25% higher at Rs 252.70 on the BSE at 12:18 pm.

Explained: Why Tata Investment share price jumped 12% todayTata Investment stock price: At 11:53 am, shares of the company were up 11.51% to Rs 7,284 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE). The surge followed reports that Tata Capital is gearing up for an initial public offering (IPO) worth Rs 15,000 crore.

Are stock markets closed on December 25? Check the full 2025 holiday scheduleOn regular weekdays, the stock market operates from 9:15 AM to 3:30 PM. A pre-opening session takes place from 9:00 AM to 9:15 AM to set the tone for the trading day.

Which Indian insurance companies reject claims the least? Report reveals truthPeople don't just put in money but trust when they buy insurance policies to cover for medical emergencies or motor accidents. A report by the Insurance Brokers Association of India reveals how many such claims have been accepted or rejected by insurance companies in 2022-23.

Carraro India IPO: Check GMP, price band and subscription statusCarraro India IPO is a Rs 1,250 crore offer for sale (OFS) consisting of 1.77 crore shares. As this is a pure OFS, the entire proceeds will go to the selling shareholders, and the company will not raise fresh capital.

Senores Pharmaceuticals IPO: Latest subscription status, GMP; listing dateThe IPO comprises a fresh issue of shares worth Rs 500 crore and an offer-for-sale (OFS) of up to 21,00,000 equity shares by promoters and existing shareholders.

Sagility India share price rises 5% to hit upper circuit today. Here's why Sagility India debuted on the stock market with an issue price of Rs 30 per share. At its current level, the stock has surged over 63% from the IPO price, underscoring strong investor interest.

Ventive Hospitality IPO: Check GMP as listing enters last day for biddingRetail investors must apply for a minimum of 23 shares per lot, which requires a minimum investment of Rs 14,789 for retail applicants.
Sensex, Nifty open flat as market rally loses steam; TCS gains 1% The S&P BSE Sensex was up 47.25 points to 78,587.42, while the NSE Nifty50 was up by 10.80 points to 23,764.25 as of 9:30 AM.

DAM Capital Advisors IPO allotment: Step-by-step guide to check statusDAM Capital Advisors IPO allotment: The allotment status can be checked by investors through the websites of either the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) or Link Intime India Private Ltd, the registrar for the issue.

Mamata Machinery IPO: Check allotment status, latest GMP and listing date Mamata Machinery IPO allotment: Investors who have bid can check their allotment status online by logging in to either the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) website or the website of Link Intime India Private Ltd.

Stocks to watch today: Wipro, Vedanta, Adani Enterprises, TVS Motor Several companies are expected to remain in focus due to recent developments. Among them are Vedanta, Prestige Estates, Wipro, Adani Enterprises, and TVS Motor.
IPOs in 2024: Big ticket listings that failed to impressRecord-breaking IPOs in India coexist with the struggles of billion-dollar listings, reflecting both market resilience and investor caution.
Sensex ends 400 points higher, Nifty jumps as heavyweight stocks rallyThe S&P BSE Sensex added 498.58 points to end at 78,540.17, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 165.95 points to close at 23,753.45.

NSE, BSE to keep markets open on February 1 for Union Budget 2025The practice of keeping markets open during Budget Day is not new. In the past, trading was also allowed on non-working days to facilitate real-time market reactions to Budget announcements.

Senores Pharmaceuticals IPO: Should you subscribe? Check GMP, subscription Senores Pharmaceuticals IPO comprises a fresh issue of shares worth Rs 500 crore and an offer-for-sale (OFS) of up to 21,00,000 equity shares by promoters and existing shareholders.
From the world's richest to fifth: The ups and downs of Bernard Arnault Once the world's richest, Bernard Arnault lost $32 billion in 2024 but remains a luxury titan with LVMH's 75 iconic brands.

Salted, pre-packed or caramelised? Popcorn gets stuck in GST mazeThe GST Council's decision to impose different tax rates on salted, pre-packaged, and caramelised popcorn has faced criticism, with economists, industry experts, and former government officials arguing that the new tax structure adds complexity for consumers.

Mamata Machinery IPO: Check latest GMP, share price, allotment date Mamata Machinery IPO: The price band for the IPO is set between Rs 230 and Rs 243 per share. Investors can apply for a minimum lot size of 61 shares, which requires a retail investment of Rs 14,823.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Allu Arjun questioned by Hyderabad cops in Pushpa 2 stampede case Live UpdatesAllu Arjun is being questioned by the Hyderabad Police over the death of a 35-year-old woman in a stampede at Sandhya Theatre during Pushpa 2's premiere on December 4.

Flawed selection process: Congress on appointment of human rights panel chiefCongress leaders Rahul Gandhi and Mallikarjun Kharge said the selection process of the NHRC chief was "flawed" and showed the "dismissive approach of the government".

No regrets about not captaining India, but would have enjoyed it: R AshwinR Ashwin played 106 Tests and took 537 wickets, but the legendary off-spinner did not get an opportunity to lead the senior national team in the longest format of the game. Ashwin retired from international cricket on December 18.

A report by the Insurance Brokers Association of India reveals how many such claims have been accepted or rejected by insurance companies in 2022-23.

Sunita Williams shares what she likes about Christmas in new videoThe astronauts plan to enjoy special meals prepared with fresh ingredients sent from Earth, allowing them to partake in familiar holiday customs.

Hospitals can't refuse free treatment to rape, acid attack survivors: High CourtThe Delhi High Court said denying treatment to sexual assault victims was an offence for which the doctors, staff and management of the hospital could be penalised.

Eat popcorn and sleep: Shashi Tharoor on GST council's tax formula for snackCongress MP Shashi Tharoor mocked the GST Council's decision to impose varied popcorn tax slabs, sparking criticism of the system's complexity. Congress leaders called the move absurd, highlighting widespread GST evasion, tax fraud, and loopholes in compliance processes.

Agra gym trainer, posing as RAW agent, rapes Canadian woman he met on TinderOn her return to Canada, the woman found that she was pregnant. When she informed him of her condition, the gym trainer, Sahil, threatened and blocked her.

Uber reacts to man's claim of different fares for same trip on different phonesSharing his experience in a post, the man noted, "Same pickup point, destination, and time but two different phones get two different rates. It happens with me as I always get higher rates on my Uber compared to my daughter's phone."
Honda-Nissan: As merger discussions begin, see where 2 companies stand in IndiaHonda Cars India and Nissan Motor India are facing headwinds in the domestic market for multiple reasons.

'House of horror': US gay couple gets 100 years in jail for raping adopted sonsWhat was not visible to the world was the unspeakable atrocities that were committed under the guise of a picture-perfect family.
Isro Spadex mission: Why Amity University is sending spinach into spaceIsro will demonstrate the docking and undocking of two satellites in space with the SpaDeX mission.
Lebanon man sings Baby Shark for little girl on flight, passengers join in. VideoA video of a Lebanon-based man singing 'Baby Shark' for a little girl onboard a flight has charmed the internet.

Wanted drug smuggler shot dead in California; Brar, Godara gangs claim attackSunil Yadav, a drug smuggler, was killed in California's Stockton on Monday. He had used a fake passport to flee India to Dubai and then the US two years ago.

Farmer garlands minister with onions on stage in protest over price dropFarmers in Maharashtra protest plummeting onion prices by placing a garland of onions on Minister Nitesh Rane. Deputy CM Ajit Pawar urged the Centre to remove the 20 per cent export duty, citing farmer distress and climate challenges amid surplus crops.

RG Kar rape case: No evidence of struggle at crime scene, says forensic reportRG Kar Rape Case: The body of the trainee doctor was found inside the seminar hall of RG Kar hospital on August 9, triggering widespread outrage. The CBI has filed a charge-sheet against prime accused Sanjay Roy.

Diet Coke with protein shake? The new viral drink is not what experts recommendProtein Diet Coke is a blend of Diet Coke and a flavoured protein shake (mostly vanilla) that Rebecca Gordan, a teacher from Utah, introduced.

IIT Delhi student achieves 100 percentile in CAT 2025 on first attemptVagish Bhushan Nangia's inspiring journey to ace the CAT is a story of balancing academics, preparation, and perseverance. Here's how he turned challenges into stepping stones for success.

Delhi-Mumbai Expressway delayed, completion pushed to 2026. Here's why!The Delhi-Mumbai Expressway is partially open, with its first section, linking Sohna in Haryana to Dausa in Rajasthan, inaugurated by Prime Minister Narendra Modi in February 2023.

Rohit backs 'modern-day great' Virat, tight-lipped about his batting spotAustralia vs India, 4th Test: India captain Rohit Sharma expressed confidence in Virat Kohli overcoming his struggles outside the off-stump. However, the skipper refrained from revealing his batting position for the Boxing Day Test, adding to the speculation.

Kangana Ranaut reacts to Blake Lively-Justin Baldoni rowActor and MP Kangana Ranaut voiced her opinion on sexual harassment acts against women amid the ongoing fiasco between It Ends With Us stars Blake Lively and Justin Baldoni.

Exclusive: What the summon copy to actor Allu Arjun saysActor Allu Arjun has been summoned by Chikkadpally Police to appear for questioning in an ongoing investigation. The actor is required to cooperate with the probe as per the terms of the interim bail granted.

Over 1,000 vehicles stuck amid heavy snowfall in Manali rescuedA 12-hour rescue operation successfully evacuated over 1,000 stranded vehicles near the Atal Tunnel, with efforts ongoing to free those still stuck in snow.

Hidden camera found in changing room at Rameswaram temple site, two arrestedTwo individuals were arrested after a secret camera was found inside a dress changing room at Agnitheertham beach in Rameswaram, Tamil Nadu, a sacred site for devotees. Further investigation is ongoing.

Kangana Ranaut reacts to Blake Lively-Justin Baldoni rowActor and MP Kangana Ranaut voiced her opinion on sexual harassment acts against women amid the ongoing fiasco between It Ends With Us stars Blake Lively and Justin Baldoni.

Varun Dhawan visits Mahakaleshwar Temple with Atlee, Keerthy Suresh and othersAhead of the highly-anticipated release of his film Baby John, actors Varun Dhawan, Keerthy Suresh and Wamiqa Gabbi, among others, visited the Mahakaleshwar Temple in Ujjain and sought blessings from the lord. Baby John will release in theatres on December 25.

Kandyse McClure on Virgin River, Priyanka Chopra, and Diversity in Hollywood, Connection to India In an exclusive interview by India Today's Bhavna Agarwal with Kandyse McClure as she opens up about her character on Virgin River and shares heartfelt insights into being a woman of color in Hollywood, drawing inspiration from icons like Priyanka Chopra and Viola Davis, and what it means to carve a unique path in the entertainment industry.

Justin Baldoni's woman advocacy honour pulled amid Blake Lively's harassment claimsActor Justin Baldoni's award for women's advocacy has been rescinded. This follows the sexual harassment lawsuit and smear campaign allegations levelled against him by his It Ends With Us co-star, Blake Lively.

sports.headline: As India's Shami hopes fade, time for Bumrah's support group to step upTeam India has received a massive setback as fast bowler Mohammed Shami failed to recover in time for the last two Tests against Australia. Shami's absence will further mount the pressure on pace spearhead Jasprit Bumrah, who has lacked the support from other bowlers. Will other bowlers finally step up in the remaining two Tests?

Rohit Sharma's guide to captaining Jasprit Bumrah: Don't have to say anythingIndia captain Rohit Sharma explained his guide to captaining pace spearhead Jasprit Bumrah ahead of the Boxing Day Test in the ongoing Border-Gavaskar Trophy.

Fakhar Zaman breaks silence on contract snub, clarifies controversial tweetOut of favour Pakistan batter Fakhar Zaman has broken his silence on the central contract snub. Fakhar Zaman was punished for one of his tweets in 2024, which was perceived as a criticism of the Pakistan Cricket Board.

Niki Prasad to lead India's 15-member squad for ICC U19 Women's T20 World CupNiki Prasad will lead India's strong 15-member squad for the ICC U19 Women's T20 World Cup, scheduled in Malaysia from January 18 to February 2, 2025. Niki led India to a title win at the inaugural ACC U19 Women's Asia Cup in Kuala Lumpur.

Australian teenager Sam Konstas to debut in Boxing Day Test vs IndiaAustralia vs India: Sam Konstas is set to make his debut in the Boxing Day Test against India, with Australia coach Andrew McDonald confirming his selection.

Jangoo earns maiden Test call-up as West Indies name squad for Pakistan tourWest Indies batter Amir Jangoo received his first call-up to the test squad, while left-arm spinner Gudakesh Motie returns for next month's series against Pakistan, the team said on Monday.

Gill needs to back his defensive technique to shine in Australia: PontingBorder-Gavaskar Trophy: Former Australian captain Ricky Ponting offered insights into how Shubman Gill could improve his performances in challenging conditions like Australia.

R Ashwin reveals the thought process behind sudden retirementRavichandran Ashwin reflected on his sudden retirement, emphasising his focus on the game over personal celebration. He revealed how his love for experimentation and creativity led him to step away, seeking new avenues to explore his passion.

What is the story behind contest after Christmas being called 'Boxing Day Test' Curious about the origins of the name Boxing Day Test? Let us uncover the story behind it! India is all set to play the 4th Test vs Australia at the iconic MCG.

Wanindu Hasaranga returns to Sri Lanka ODI squad for New Zealand tourSri Lanka Cricket (SLC) announced a 17-member squad for the upcoming three-match ODI series against New Zealand. Wanindu Hasaranga marks his return after recovering from hamstring injury.

R Ashwin reflects on India career after retirement: Don't cry because it's overRavichandran Ashwin shared a special message on Instagram after announcing his retirement from international cricket. Checkout what the Indian legend has to say as the cricketing world still overcomes the shocking announcement.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
